Name: 4_plastic_plastics_waste_microplastics

Every piece of plastic ever produced still exists in our environment and bodies. The more we produce, the more plastics will pile up. We can protect future generations and ourselves from accumulating even more plastic by swiftly starting to reduce, and eventually end, plastic production.

Name: 9_heat_pump_pumps_heating
Representative_Docs: I have heat pump, it’s true. I also have water radiator with gas boiler. I use that mostly for winter because it thrives on cold draft to covert it to heat. My heat pump struggled to keep up, costing me too much money

We installed one last year. We love it. It's a hybrid, which means it has heating elements if we need more hot water than the heat pump can supply, we don't need them. We get all the hot water we need from the heat pump.

With no heat pump, it must rely on resistance. That sounds expensive around here where gas energy is 16 the price of electricity. Maybe 14 with variable electric pricing. In combination with a heat pump, it would be excellent for bridging extreme cold snaps when heat pumps don't function well.

Name: 22_cars_transport_car_bike
Representative_Docs: Hey, edinburghcouncil.bsky.social, we can change too! Edinburgh is a great city for cycling despite the weather but more needs to be done. Shifting from cars to bikes and public transport is a benefit for all.

People who only drive need to understand that cutting transit funding will make roads busier, and it will cost much more money than they cut to fund the increased road use. Also cars pollute the city much more in terms of noise, emissions and particulates.

My response to it is that cars are still cars. Traffic, pollution, and all other negative externalities aren't because of drivers per se, but because they're driving CARS. A person walking, cycling, or taking transit won't affect the same level of damage.

Name: 76_15c_tipping_warming_points
Representative_Docs: What does it mean to exceed and return to,,global warming of 1.5°C? httpswww.byteseu.com922430 Many national and corporate climate targets seek to limit global warming to 1.5°C. Yet, global warming continues to increase. It makes it almost inevitable that 1.5°C of global warming will be

"Tipping points" are "thresholds where a small additional change in global warming will cause major biophysical systems to irreversibly shift into a new state." Cascading tipping points occur when crossing one threshold triggers another, so on. We should be extremely scared of these. So...

Exploring the risks of cascading’ tipping points in a warming world. The authors of a review study on cascading tipping points unpack the current state of scientific understanding of the interactions between individual tipping elements. pdpwbj.clicks.mlsend.comtdceyJ2Ijo...

Name: 107_chocolate_easter_cocoa_eciunet
Representative_Docs: Easter chocolate prices rise in the UK as a cocoa crisis looms Farmers in Ivory Coast, the world’s largest cocoa producer, warn that cocoa trees could be wiped out by 2030 due to the climate crisis and underinvestment. Read more in the-independent.com www.independent.co.ukclimate-chan...
Easter chocolate cocoa price up a third as extreme weather and climate change bite eciu.netmediapress-...

Noticed the soaring cost of chocolate? With climate change pushing up cocoa prices, I looked at how some companies hope to grow cocoa in vats instead of on trees And, yes, cultured chocolate really does taste like chocolate www.newscientist.comarticlemg26...
